title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe how a decrease in the wood rat population would affect higher trophic levels in the short term, such as any of the following:

· The red-tailed hawk population would also decrease.

· The rattlesnake population would also decrease.

· The coyote population would also decrease.

· The grasshopper mouse population would also decrease.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain why the velvet mesquite trees could be considered a keystone species of the desert ecosystem, such as any of the following:

· Velvet mesquite trees increase the amount of usable nitrogen in the soil by harboring nitrogen-fixing bacteria. This usable nitrogen is a limiting factor for plant growth.

· Since many organisms depend on the mesquites for survival, a decrease in the population of these trees would have a disproportionate impact on the ecosystem.

The response explains why the velvet mesquite trees could be considered a keystone species of the desert ecosystem, such as one of the following:

· Velvet mesquite trees increase the amount of usable nitrogen in the soil by harboring nitrogen-fixing bacteria. This usable nitrogen is a limiting factor for plant growth.

· Since many organisms depend on the mesquites for survival, a decrease in the population of these trees would have a disproportionate impact on the ecosystem.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how a decrease in velvet mesquite trees from this ecosystem would affect the nitrogen cycle, such as any of the following:

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease nitrogen soil concentration, which decrease availability of nitrogen to other plants.

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease nitrogen soil concentration, because there would be less nitrogen fixation/less nitrogen-fixing bacteria.

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease ammonia levels, which would decrease the availability of ammonia to other plants.

The response explains how a decrease in velvet mesquite trees from this ecosystem would affect the nitrogen cycle, such as one of the following:

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease nitrogen soil concentration, which decrease availability of nitrogen to other plants.

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease nitrogen soil concentration, because there would be less nitrogen fixation/less nitrogen-fixing bacteria.

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease ammonia levels, which would decrease the availability of ammonia to other plants.

title: Part G

title: Part J

descriptions:
